Package net.ssehub.comani.utility

Class FileUtilities

java.lang.Object
net.ssehub.comani.utility.FileUtilities
public class FileUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides utility methods for creating, deleting, and checking files and directories.
Author:
Christian Kroeher

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static FileUtilities getInstance()
    Returns the single instance of the FileUtilities.
    java.util.List<java.lang.String> readFile​(java.io.File file)
    Reads the content of the given file and returns a list of strings in which each string contains a single line of the content of the file.
    boolean writeFile​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String fileContent, boolean override)
    Writes the given content to the file specified by the given path and file name.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static FileUtilities getInstance()
      Returns the single instance of the FileUtilities.
      Returns:
      the single instance of the FileUtilities

    • writeFile

      public boolean writeFile​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String fileContent, boolean override)
      Writes the given content to the file specified by the given path and file name.
      Parameters:
      path - the string representation of the path denoting the location the file shall be saved
      fileName - the name of the file to be created or overridden; this name should contain a file extension
      fileContent - the content which shall be written to the file
      override - specifies whether to override an existing file (true) or not (false)
      Returns:
      true if creating and writing the file was successful; false otherwise

    • readFile

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readFile​(java.io.File file)
      Reads the content of the given file and returns a list of strings in which each string contains a single line of the content of the file.
      Parameters:
      file - the File the content should be read from
      Returns:
      a List of Strings representing the line-wise content of the given file; may return null if the given file cannot be read
